001package com.technototes.library.util;
002
003import com.qualcomm.robotcore.util.Range;
004
005/**
006 * Class with various math functions
007 *
008 * @author Alex Stedman
009 */
010public class MathUtils {
011
012    /**
013     * Get the max of supplied doubles
014     *
015     * @param args The doubles
016     * @return The max
017     */
018    public static double getMax(double... args) {
019        double max = args[0];
020        for (int i = 1; i < args.length; i++) {
021            max = Math.max(max, args[i]);
022        }
023        return max;
024    }
025
026    /**
027     * Get the max of supplied ints
028     *
029     * @param args The ints
030     * @return The max
031     */
032    public static int getMax(int... args) {
033        int max = 0;
034        for (int i = 1; i < args.length; i++) {
035            max = Math.max(args[i - 1], args[i]);
036        }
037        return max;
038    }
039
040    /**
041     * Calculate pythagorean theorem of any number of sides
042     *
043     * @param vals The sides
044     * @return The hypotenuse
045     */
046    public static double pythag(double... vals) {
047        double total = 0;
048        for (double d : vals) {
049            total += d * d;
050        }
051        return Math.sqrt(total);
052    }
053
054    /**
055     * Constrain the supplied int
056     * Please use com.qualcomm.robotcore.util.Range.clip
057     *
058     * @param min The minimum of the constraint
059     * @param num The number to constrain
060     * @param max The maximum of the constraint
061     * @return The constrained number
062     * @deprecated
063     */
064    public static int constrain(int min, int num, int max) {
065        return num < min ? min : (num > max ? max : num);
066    }
067
068    /**
069     * Constrain the supplied double
070     * Please use com.qualcomm.robotcore.util.Range.clip
071     *
072     * @param min The minimum of the constraint
073     * @param num The number to constrain
074     * @param max The maximum of the constraint
075     * @return The constrained number
076     * @deprecated
077     */
078    public static double constrain(double min, double num, double max) {
079        return num < min ? min : (num > max ? max : num);
080    }
081
082    /**
083     * Calculate if the supplied number is prime
084     *
085     * @param number The number to check
086     * @return If number is prime
087     */
088    public static boolean isPrime(int number) {
089        if ((number % 2) == 0) {
090            return false;
091        }
092        for (int i = 3; i * i <= number; i += 2) {
093            if (number % i == 0) {
094                return false;
095            }
096        }
097        return true;
098    }
099
100    /**
101     * Scale a value originally between in_min and in_max to be the same ratio when mapped to
102     * out_min and out_max. For example:
103     * * map(0.1, -0.2, 0.2, -1.0, 1.0) will return 0.5
104     * * map(.5, 0, 1, -1, 1) will return 0
105     *
106     * @param x
107     * @param in_min
108     * @param in_max
109     * @param out_min
110     * @param out_max
111     * @return
112     */
113    public static double map(
114        double x,
115        double in_min,
116        double in_max,
117        double out_min,
118        double out_max
119    ) {
120        return (x - in_min) * (out_max - out_min) / (in_max - in_min) + out_min;
121    }
122
123    /**
124     * Returns the value from a list which is closed to the first value.
125     * This is useful for trying to identify an angle you'd like a drivebase to 'snap to'.
126     * If you can accomplish this through a simple mathematical expression, do that instead.
127     * It will probably be faster.
128     *
129     * @param d      The current value
130     * @param values The list of 'snapped' values we want to
131     * @return the element from 'values' that is closest to 'd'
132     */
133    public static double closestTo(double d, double... values) {
134        int lowestDif = 0;
135        for (int i = 1; i < values.length; i++) {
136            if (Math.abs(values[lowestDif] - d) > Math.abs(values[i] - d)) lowestDif = i;
137        }
138        return values[lowestDif];
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * Returns the value from a list which is closed to the first value.
143     * This is useful for trying to identify an angle you'd like a drivebase to 'snap to'.
144     * If you can accomplish this through a simple mathematical expression, do that instead.
145     * It will probably be faster.
146     *
147     * @param d      The current value
148     * @param values The list of 'snapped' values we want to
149     * @return the element from 'values' that is closest to 'd'
150     */
151    public static int closestTo(double d, int... values) {
152        int lowestDif = 0;
153        for (int i = 1; i < values.length; i++) {
154            if (Math.abs(values[lowestDif] - d) > Math.abs(values[i] - d)) lowestDif = i;
155        }
156        return values[lowestDif];
157    }
158}
